topic.title: Inserting and Defining Keys in DITA Maps

body.p: DITA uses keys to insert content that may have different values in various circumstances. Keys provide the means for indirect referencing in DITA. This can make it easier to manage and to reuse content. In DITA, keys are defined in maps and can then reused and referenced throughout the whole structure of the map.

The following example is a DITA map that defines various values for the product key:<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?> <!DOCTYPE map PUBLIC "-//OASIS//DTD DITA Map//EN" "map.dtd"> <map> <!-- product name --> <keydef keys="product" product="basic"> <topicmeta> <keywords> <keyword>Basic Widget</keyword> </keywords> </topicmeta> </keydef> <keydef keys="product" product="pro"> <topicmeta> <keywords> <keyword>Professional Widget</keyword> </keywords> </topicmeta> </keydef> <keydef keys="product" product="enterprise"> <topicmeta> <keywords> <keyword>Enterprise Widget</keyword> </keywords> </topicmeta> </keydef> </map>

p.note: The profiling of the names is now contained in the map, where it only has to occur once to reuse throughout the whole map structure.

body.p:
To insert a key definition in a DITA map, follow these steps:
Open the DITA map in the DITA Maps Manager.
Invoke the contextual menu and select Key Definition from the Append Child or Insert After submenu (depending on where you want to insert the key definition in the DITA map). This opens the Insert Reference dialog box.
Go to the Keys tab and enter the name of the key in the Define keys field.
You can profile the key by using the Profiling tab.
You can also easily add metadata elements in the key definition by using the Metadata tab.
Other attributes can also be defined in the Attributes tab.
Once you are done configuring the key definition, click Insert and close.
Depending on which profiling conditions are active in , you will see different values of the key displayed in Author mode.
